dict.string: Kate's soccer team did two fundraisers last year. They raised $243 selling candy and $957 washing cars. How much money did the team raise in all?
Barry wants to go ice skating. The admission will cost $4.88, and the skate rental will cost $5.26. What will the total cost be?

Stanley buys a flashlight costing $6.11. He gives the cashier two five-dollar bills. The cashier gives him his change using the least number of coins and bills possible. How many quarters does he receive?
Mandy buys a hamster wheel costing $7.42. She gives the cashier $10.00. The cashier gives her change using the least number of coins and bills possible. How many dimes does she receive?
You pay 85¢ to buy a granola bar costing 76¢. You receive 5 coins back. How many nickels did you receive?
You bought a bag of sugar which costs $2.89. You gave 2 one dollar bill and few quarters to the cashier. How many quarters did you give to the cashier?
A pear costs 32 cents, mango is 42 cents and banana is 30 cents. You have 1 quarter, 1 nickel and 1 penny. Which fruit can you buy?
A slice of cake costs $4.12. You went to shop with a 5 dollar bill. You returned with the cake. What is the maximum number of quarters you might have with you?

Which sign makes the statement true?
2 quarters ? 6 dimes
You pay $4.00 to buy a hairbrush costing $3.20. You receive 4 coins as an exact change. How many nickels you might have received?
